bestBHT.bht: Like thieves, the moneychangers and merchants have turned God's house into a den of dishonesty, disregarding its purpose as a house of prayer. Jesus's strong rebuke reminds us to preserve the reverence and purity of our places of worship.

Marvin Vincent: Thieves [ληστων] . See on Matthew 26:55; Luke 10:30; Mark 11:17.
John Gill: My house is the house of prayer; built and devoted for that service.
Ye have made it a den of thieves.

bhtAttempts.bht: Jesus confronts the corruption within the temple in Luke 19:46. Like thieves, the moneychangers and merchants have turned God's house into a den of dishonesty, completely disregarding its intended purpose as a house of prayer. This distortion of the temple's sanctity is reminiscent of Isaiah 56:7, which emphasizes the importance of maintaining a sacred space for worship. Jesus's harsh rebuke serves as a reminder to us all to preserve the reverence and purity of our places of worship.

Like thieves, the moneychangers and merchants have turned God's house into a den of dishonesty, disregarding its purpose as a house of prayer. Jesus's strong rebuke reminds us to preserve the reverence and purity of our places of worship.

Jesus confronts the corruption within the temple, addressing the merchants who have turned it into a den of thieves, instead of a house of prayer. His strong words emphasize the importance of maintaining the sanctity of the temple, as expressed in Isaiah 56:7. This incident serves as a reminder to us to uphold the reverence and purity of our places of worship.

Jesus's confrontation in the temple highlights the corruption present within it, likening the moneychangers and merchants to thieves. Their actions have transformed God's house into a den of dishonesty, disregarding its intended purpose as a place of prayer. This rebuke echoes Isaiah 56:7's emphasis on the significance of a sacred space. It serves as a reminder to ensure that our places of worship are maintained with reverence and purity.

Jesus denounces the corruption within the temple, comparing the moneychangers and merchants to thieves. Their actions have transformed God's sacred house into a den of dishonesty, a complete departure from its original purpose of being a place of prayer. This rebuke resonates with the message of Isaiah 56:7, which underscores the importance of maintaining the sanctity of the temple. We are reminded of the significance of preserving the reverence and purity of our places of worship.
